cons: You can potentially overdose on Brazil nuts and have selenium toxicity. Symptoms can include diarrhea, a metallic taste in the mouth, nausea, brittle nails, hair loss, coughing and more.
description: Brazil nuts are commonly eaten raw or blanched and are high in protein, fiber, selenium, thiamine, copper and magnesium and in addition to being the best selenium food source in the world, they provide numerous benefits for our health.
Brazil nuts are high in calories, contain good quantities of vitamins, anti-oxidants, and minerals.
The nuts are also a great source of vitamin-E,Vitamin-E is a powerful lipid soluble antioxidant.
Brazil nuts hold exceptionally high levels of selenium,Selenium is an essential cofactor for the anti-oxidant enzyme, glutathione peroxidase.
